content: I also encountered that you can't clear the emoji without clearing the whole status (unless I missed something!)

My original implementation of this was going to allow that via selecting the same emoji from the emoji-picker again, but we ended up not doing that. If we think that's the right UX then we should be able to implement. (for clarity, the proposal is that your current status emoji will show up in a selected state in the emoji picker, which you could click / choose again to remove the status emoji)

Evy Kassirer said:

I also encountered that you can't clear the emoji without clearing the whole status (unless I missed something!)

Mm, interesting. Were you trying to set a status message without having an emoji at all? I actually think it might not be bad to have the UI discourage that pattern, since the status message ends up being pretty obscure in that case. From what I can tell by playing with it, Slack doesn't allow this at all.
Though, arguing against myself, I guess the status message is pretty visible in the compose box if you are PMing with someone. Hmmm.
What if we gave the emoji an x on hover, if you have an emoji selected? Clicking on the x would remove the emoji but not the status message.
Hmm, but the click handler for the emoji selects a new emoji; I'm not sure there's space for that.
A simpler option might be to have a "clear emoji" button in the picker popover.
I was imagining an x that only takes over the upper right part of the emoji area, but maybe it's too much going on in one little box.
It's a little silly, but we could also scoot the emoji | status text separator over to the right to make room for an x just to the right of the emoji.
11 messages were moved here from #feedback > emoji status by Alya Abbott.
Moving the conversation here, since it's shifted to a specific design question regarding how to make it possible to remove a status emoji without clearing status text while setting one's status.
My use case is that I wanted to add pronouns somewhere visible, and it seems like status is the best place for that right now? But I don't want an emoji always beside my name.
I think the thing I expected at the time was a clear emoji button in the popover, though that doesn't mean that's the best solution.
